medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Abdominal pain began yesterday at 2 pm, initially diffuse but migrated to the right lower quadrant (RLQ). Associated symptoms include nausea and vomiting. He had some loose, non-bloody stool initially, which has since resolved. The pain is constant, slightly alleviated by bending knees and pain medication. The patient experiences chills and had a temperature of 100Â°F prior to arrival.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) or gastrointestinal malignancy.
